Anyone have this problem? JUnit runs fine on its own. If I try to run 
a Test class from within Ant I get noclassdeffound.

Here's the ant part:

<junit fork="no">
  <classpath>
    <pathelement path="${CLASSPATH}" />
  </classpath>
  <formatter type="xml" />
  <batchtest>
    <fileset dir="${classesloc}">
      <include name="com/spotfire/util/*Test.class" />
    </fileset>
  </batchtest>
</junit>

I'm getting this from ant (when I run in verbose mode):

C:\>ant -v -DCLASSPATH=%CLASSPATH%
Ant version 1.4 compiled on September 3 2001
Buildfile: build.xml
Detected Java version: 1.3 in: c:\jdk1.3\jre
Detected OS: Windows 2000
parsing buildfile C:\build.xml with URI = file:C:/build.xml
Project base dir set to: C:\
Build sequence for target `junit' is [init, junit]
Complete build sequence is [init, junit]

init:

junit:
    [junit] Using System properties {}
    [junit] Using CLASSPATH ...[HERE IT GIVES ME AN OK PATH, WITH 
JUNIT IN IT AND ALSO THE PATH THAT HOLDS MY /CLASSES/ DIRECTORY 
(WHICH HAS COM/SPOTFIRE/UTIL/ IN IT)]

BUILD FAILED

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/spotfire/util/DateFormatterTest 
(wrong name: DateFormatterTest)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)


Idea what's going on? I've got the path to the directory that 
contains my packaged in the classpath above. Anything I'm missing???

Thanks,

/Ed
subject: noclassdeffound with ant?
